timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -5001,6 +4989,243 @@ public SelectResponseStream selectObjectContent( return new SelectResponseStream(response.body().byteStream()); } + /** + * Gets tags of a bucket. + * + * 
Example:{@code
+   * Tags tags =
+   *     minioClient.getBucketTags(GetBucketTagsArgs.builder().bucket("my-bucketname").build());
+   * }
+ * + * @param args {@link GetBucketTagsArgs} object. + * @return {@link Tags} - Tags. + * @throws ErrorResponseException thrown to indicate S3 service returned an error response. + * @throws IllegalArgumentException throws to indicate invalid argument passed. + * @throws InsufficientDataException thrown to indicate not enough data available in InputStream. + * @throws InternalException thrown to indicate internal library error. + * @throws InvalidBucketNameException thrown to indicate invalid bucket name passed. + * @throws InvalidKeyException thrown to indicate missing of HMAC SHA-256 library. + * @throws InvalidResponseException thrown to indicate S3 service returned invalid or no error + * response. + * @throws IOException thrown to indicate I/O error on S3 operation. + * @throws NoSuchAlgorithmException thrown to indicate missing of MD5 or SHA-256 digest library. + * @throws XmlParserException thrown to indicate XML parsing error. + */ + public Tags getBucketTags(GetBucketTagsArgs args) + throws ErrorResponseException, IllegalArgumentException, InsufficientDataException, + InternalException, InvalidBucketNameException, InvalidKeyException, + InvalidResponseException, IOException, NoSuchAlgorithmException, XmlParserException { + if (args == null) { + throw new IllegalArgumentException("null arguments"); + }

timeline.body:
Maybe these two lines can go into a private method called `taggingParams()` which can then be directly used in the call to the `executeGet()` method.

Will be useful as same code is being used in multiple methods.

replies.bodyText: I think we would need to fix this across everywhere using Multimap. It can be done in separate PR.
replies.author: balamurugana

timeline.body:
```suggestion
    executePut(args.bucket(), null, null, queryParamMap, args.tags(), 0).body().close();
```

The variable `response` doesn't seem necessary.
timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
Response response = executePut(args.bucket(), null, null, queryParamMap, args.tags(), 0);
response.body().close();
executePut(args.bucket(), null, null, queryParamMap, args.tags(), 0).body().close();

The variable response doesn't seem necessary.
timeline.author: anjalshireesh

timeline.bodyHTML:
One try block and the response variable can be avoided with something like:

Suggested change
try {
Response response = executeGet(args.bucket(), null, null, queryParamMap);
try (ResponseBody body = response.body()) {
return Xml.unmarshal(Tags.class, body.charStream());
}
try (ResponseBody body = executeGet(args.bucket(), null, null, queryParamMap).body()) {
return Xml.unmarshal(Tags.class, body.charStream());
timeline.author: anjalshireesh

timeline.body: Should this condition not throw an exception?
timeline.bodyText: Should this condition not throw an exception?
timeline.bodyHTML: Should this condition not throw an exception?
timeline.author: anjalshireesh

replies.bodyText: Setting null tags is fine which is meant to remove all existing tags. In this case <Tagging /> XML is sent.
replies.author: balamurugana

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
if (isObject) {
if (tags.size() > MAX_OBJECT_TAG_COUNT) {
throw new IllegalArgumentException(
"too many object tags; allowed = " + MAX_OBJECT_TAG_COUNT + ", found = " + tags.size());
}
} else if (tags.size() > MAX_TAG_COUNT) {
throw new IllegalArgumentException(
"too many bucket tags; allowed = " + MAX_TAG_COUNT + ", found = " + tags.size());
}
String type = isObject ? "object" : "bucket"
int limit = isObject ? MAX_OBJECT_TAG_COUNT : MAX_TAG_COUNT
if(tags.size() > limit) {
throw new IllegalArgumentException(
"too many " + type + " tags; allowed = " + limit + ", found = " + tags.size());
}
timeline.author: anjalshireesh

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
if (tags == null) {
return Collections.unmodifiableMap(new HashMap<>());
}
return Collections.unmodifiableMap(tags);
}
return Collections.unmodifiableMap(tags == null ? new HashMap<>() : tags)
timeline.author: anjalshireesh

timeline.body:
* Better to have two separate `catch` blocks - one for the specific `ErrorResponseException` and the other for the generic `Exception`
* Since the part of ignoring NOT_IMPLEMENTED is used multiple times, the whole logic can be implemented in a common method, to look something like `ignoreNotImplemented(exp, "setBucketTags(SetBucketTagsArgs args)", startTime);`
timeline.bodyText:
Better to have two separate catch blocks - one for the specific ErrorResponseException and the other for the generic Exception
Since the part of ignoring NOT_IMPLEMENTED is used multiple times, the whole logic can be implemented in a common method, to look something like ignoreNotImplemented(exp, "setBucketTags(SetBucketTagsArgs args)", startTime);
timeline.bodyHTML:
• Better to have two separate catch blocks - one for the specific ErrorResponseException and the other for the generic Exception
  • Since the part of ignoring NOT_IMPLEMENTED is used multiple times, the whole logic can be implemented in a common method, to look something like ignoreNotImplemented(exp, "setBucketTags(SetBucketTagsArgs args)", startTime);
timeline.author: anjalshireesh
